final_state.submission:
Crimson leaves descend,  
A chill wind hums through bare branches—  
Time's breath on my cheek.  

Frost paints windowpanes,  
Silent stars blink through the darkness—  
Eons in their gaze.  

Blossoms kiss the stream,  
Petals drift like fleeting hours—  
Life's soft, whispered song.  

Golden fields sway low,  
Harvest moon glows, ripe and full—  
Memories linger.  

Footprints fade in sand,  
Waves erase what once was there—  
Love's echo remains.

River softly hums,
rippling notes through moonlit reeds—
time whispers gently.

Cherry blossoms fall,
perfume fading on warm breeze—
moments drift away.

Leaves crisp and golden
crunch beneath my cautious steps—
echoes of seasons.

Snowflakes kiss my cheek,
cold crystals melting to tears—
fleeting memories.

Stars blaze silently,
countless as heartbeats lost, found—
we are whispered time.

Autumn leaves falling
Whisper secrets to the ground
Time's gentle descent

Moonlight casts shadows
Ever-changing on still ponds
Night's silent passage

Cherry blossoms bloom
Pink petals dance on the breeze
Spring's fleeting beauty

Tides ebb and they flow
Eternal rhythm of waves 
Nature's timekeeper

Wrinkled hands reach out
To catch memories drifting by
Life's precious moments

Autumn branches sway
Time's gentle breeze whispers through
Golden leaves falling

Stream carves ancient stone
Patient water's touch reshapes
Mountains bow to drops

Moonlight shifts shadows
Night blooms release sweet perfume
Seasons breathe and turn

Stars fade at sunrise
Cycles unbroken, unchanged
Human hearts still wait

The rustle of leaves,
A soft whisper through the air,
Time's gentle caress.

The scent of fresh dew,
Morning blooms in fleeting light,
Moments slip away.

Rivers carve their path,
The sound of water's journey,
Life flows, ever on.

In the forest deep,
Whispers of time echoed,
Leaves in dance swayed.

Scent of pine cones fall,
Glistening dew on petals,
Ephemeral grace.

Rivers carve the land,
Eternal in their flow,
Mirror to the sky.

Sunsets paint the clouds,
Each hue a fleeting moment,
Silent lullaby.

Ancient stones stand tall,
Witness to loves and losses,
Our hearts beat with time.
